titleStmt.title: Amaramālā: Digital Critical Edition of British Library, Burnell 436e

licence.p: This work is licenced under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 Unported Licence. To view a copy of the licence, visit https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/ or send a letter to Creative Commons, 444 Castro Street, Suite 900, Mountain View, California, 94041, USA.

objectDesc.p: As per the description by Keith & Thomas (1935: 315, no. 5172), the text is written in Devanāgarī script across nine folios of paper, each measuring 6.5 by 3.5 inches.

handNote.p: Main hand of the manuscript, black ink, Devanagari script

projectDesc.p: Encoded in TEI according to the Conventions of ERC-Project DHARMA.

normalization.p:
Our edition silently standardizes punctuation and normalizes spellings involving
the differences b/v; ...
degemination of a consonant before v
editorial use of avagraha

revisionDesc.change: Encode teiHeader and bibliography; solved validation problems

div.ab:
śrī-gaṇeśāya namaḥ || śrī-gurucaraṇa-carṇa--kamalebhyō
namaḥ || śrī-sarasvatyai namaḥ || śriyai namaḥ ||

app.note: Harunaga Isaacsonpoints out to us that this verse is very similar to the opening verse of Anubhūti Svarūpācārya's Sārasvatavyākaraṇa: praṇamya paramātmānaṁ bāla-dhī-vr̥ddhi-siddhaye sārasvatīm r̥juṁ kurve prakriyāṁ nātivistarām

lg.l: upalabdhighupajabdhiIt imay be that hyupalabdhi is written, or was intended. Scan up'labdhi.-jñānakārakā |

saṁjava rabhasambhol arvat svājī vega tathā
ntara ||

kīrtti-nāma || aṁsuga-bhakti
gaś caiva marīcis tu mayūkhamayūṣa-kara-

It seems that we now get synonyms of peacock, but the heading has been omitted. barhiśikhī ca nīlakaṁṭhī ca vyāla
bhuk
śivasunūvāhanaścaivaśivasūnuvāhana makes sense but it seems to be hypermetrical kalāpī ca mayūrakaḥ ||

kaṁṭīravakaṁṭīrada-mr̥gapati
puṁḍarīkaś ca yakṣapōjakṣapōCf. Revākhaṇḍa of the Skandapurāṇa 78.9–10: caturtho lokapālānām akṣayo yakṣapo 'pi vā | yakṣo yakṣādhipaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ kuṇḍadhāro 'bhavat sutaḥ | susvaṁrūpavayaḥ prāpya mātāpitror anujñayā || tapaś cakāra vipulaṁ narmadātīram āśritaḥ | yatra vyāghreśvaraṁ liṅgaṁ vyāghrakheṭakam uttamam ||.
mr̥garājas tu siṁhaś ca || durāda Corr. dvirada ?-ghnaś ca kēśarī ||
aśva-nāma || haya-saiṁdhava-vājī ca turagaś ca turaṁgama

vākanot sure, but possibly hya is written or at least intended here
śva-ghōṭakaścaiva pūpāit looks like śpā, error for śvā? still, I don't see śvākarṇa as synonym of 'horse' anywhere.or, maybe śyā ? But I don't know yet that the cluster -'va' and -'ya' are interchangeable also in Sanskrit mss. as they are in Javanese script.. If so, then we have to accept śvākarṇa as synonym for 'horse' karṇāśca yadāvukaheḍāvuka ?I see yajñapuk, yajñavuk or yajñadhuk. The latter could mean 'milking the sacrifice'. I don't know any synonym of 'horse' like this. ||

karībha-karībhaḥ vāra
na Corr. vāraṇa-vyālaḥ staṁvaṁsuṁgr̥la Corr. stamberama-suṁḍāla-nāguhāṭō ?-

nāga-hage-matta-mātāṁga-nāgaśca mapaṁ
dānagapa-gaja ekadantōēkaṁdaṁtō dvidaṁtaśca kajālēor kukṣāle? kakṣāle? I don't know yet which word is intended.-vasabhamrabhīsamasamī? not yet sure... ||
aṣṭasiddhi-nāmā || aṇimā mahimā caiva garimā laghimān tathā

nidhi-nāma || ma
hāpadmaś ca padmaś ca

manōratha-nāma || kāmō bhilāṣa-tarṣūś ca vaṣama
saca manōratha ||

div.ab:
mōkṣa-nāma || mukti-amr̥ta-kaivālyaṁ
nirvāṇaṁ hyapavargakaṁ mahāsiddhipada-svarga-mukti-śrēyasa
stathā ..
rājā-nāma .. svāmī bhūpati-bhūpaś ca adhipatiś ca pari
vr̥ḍhaḥ-vr̥ḍhī
-adhīśaśca prabhuśprabhu caiva hyadhirājas tathaiva ca ..
maṁgala-nāma ||
kujaḥ aṁgārakaś caiva lōhitāṁgō mahīsutaḥmahisutaḥ hāvabhālaka
kalkī ca bhavanaśca bhaumakastathā ..
śukra-nāma .. śukrō daityaguru
kāvya uśanā-bhargava-kavi ..
br̥haspati-nāma .. br̥haspati-dēvagu
rō dhiṣaṇā .. śrīṣaṁḍa-hyaṁgirāghayaliśca gurōś caiva tathā
dēvapurōhitaṁ ..
srōtā-nāma ||
śaśigirī Corr. taraṁgiṇī ? ca jalajamuktāguli
kaśīpasuta Corr. kāśyapasutaḥ. Cf. Vaijayantī 1.1.37 garuḍaḥ kāśyapasuto garutmān uragāśanaḥ | suparṇītanayas tārkṣyo vainateyo mahendrajit || ..
lakṣmī-nāma .. lakṣmī-padmālayā-padmā ka
malā-śrī-haripriyā iṁdirā-lōkamātāmā Corr. lōkamātā capalārkamahāmō
kṣīrābdhitanayā caiva tathā ca viṣṇuva’bhabha Corr. viṣṇuvatsalā ? The reading ṣṇu is very uncertain. But if it is correct (or if this reading was originally intended) then we might emend viṣṇuvatsalā. But it doesn't look like this was actually written.Could the last word be read as vacchalā = vatsalā?.. mātā-nāma ACM 557cd-558ab: māturmātāmahādyevaṃ mātāmbā jananī prasūḥ || savitrī janayitrī ca kṛmilā tu bahuprasūḥ | −
aṁbā-janani Corr. jananī-sāvitrī-mātā-sujani-iṁdirā ..
namaskāra-nāma −
abhivādanaṁ namasakāraḥ vadanaṁ praṇatiṁ tathā ..
sīḍhī It is a Hindi word for ladder.-nāma ॰
ārōhaṇaṁ ca niśrēṇī sōpānaṁ ca maṇimayaṁ ..
kanyā-nāma •
duhitā kaṁnyakā putrī tanayā tanujā sutā ..
śayyā-nāma (..)
kasīpu-talpa-śayyā ca śayana-saṁvēśanantathā dugdhaphēnaI don't understand what this term is doing here, unless it is a metaphor for semen.-
bhramāśayyā śayānīya tathaiva ca ..
kusuma-nāma ॰
(pra)sūna-kusumaṁ puṣpaṁ sumanaśca sugaṁdhi-suma ..this reading seems very doubtfulprobably one final syllable and a spacing mark
2

Read khamanaṁ?_Assigned to Andrew Ollett_ वक्त्रकं मुखंPañcatattvaprakāśaānanaṃ vadanaṃ vaktraṃ mukham āsyaṃ radālayam |kākapakṣaṃ śikhā veṇir veṇī kuntalaśṛṅkhalā || 80 || भृ

च तनूरुहं ॥ chuḍashould be error for cuḍā?the meaning doesn't fit. we must have chudraghaṁṭikā. seeAK.02.06.110ab haṃsakaḥ pādakaṭakaḥ kiṃkiṇī kṣudraghaṇṭikāconfusion of ch/kṣ is very common in Devanagari mss. घंटिका-नामAM CK:253Synonyms of Woman’s Girdlemekhalā, saptakī, kāñcī, kakṣyā, raśanā, ṅa kəṇḍit. ॥ किंकिनी Corr. kiṁkiṇī-रसना कांची
मेषला Corr. mekhalā-jālaकं तथा chudrā valimanumāna dyurdyurī vaṁra
mālikā || सरकसAM CK:50Synonyms of Quivertūṇo niṣaṅgas tūṇīraḥ, upāsaṅgaś ca bāṇadhiḥ,śaradhiś cāpi tūṇistrī, iṣudhir astriyāṁ bhavet. Corr. śarakasa ?-नाम ॥ उपासंगश्च तूनीर Corr. tūṇīra इषुधी

kaṁ .. jugula-nāma .. jamālaṁ yugalaṁ dvaṁdvaṁ mithunaṁ
dvai ubhēnica .. itiścī amarācāryyēṇa kr̥taṁ
amaramālā saṁpūrṇam saṁ 1827 kālāXX
kā8caṁra ī sa 1871 pharanaṭī 21 ajñēramadhyē paṁḍi
tavālabhukaṁ denasvanibhicāṁlipiXtaṁ ..

div.p: Cataloged by Keith & Thomas (1935); referred to in NCC.
